definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Still, he cannot change the active nature.
sentences.chinese: 但他还是改不了“好动的本性”。

sentences.english: Children prefer climbing to hiking. They are full of beans.
sentences.chinese: 好动的孩子对爬山比行山更有兴趣。

sentences.english: He once was a very active and happy boy.
sentences.chinese: 他以前很活泼好动，是一个快乐的孩子。

sentences.english: A. She compared the restless boy with a noisy monkey.
sentences.chinese: 她把那个好动的男孩比做一只吵闹的猴子。

sentences.english: The Labrador is an active breed.
sentences.chinese: 拉不拉多是很好动的品种。

sentences.english: That way, your dog will be less active during the day.
sentences.chinese: 那样一来，您的爱犬在白天时就不会那么好动。

sentences.english: This is also a great activity for your kinaesthetic learners.
sentences.chinese: 对于好动的学生来说，这更是一个很好的练习。

sentences.english: "He was very vigorous from Day One, " Meese said.
sentences.chinese: “它从第一天开始就很好动，”米斯说。

definition: to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
fear of strangers/to be afraid of strangers (of small children)
to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
